policy_document.title: Rent Stabilization Ordinance Amendment
policy_document.text:
SECTION 1. Purpose and Intent

This ordinance amends the Rent Stabilization Ordinance to establish new protections for tenants against excessive rent increases and hidden fees.

SECTION 2. Key Provisions

(a) Annual rent increases shall not exceed 5% of the base rent or the change in the Consumer Price Index, whichever is lower.

(b) Landlords must provide 90 days written notice before implementing any rent increase.

(c) No additional fees may be charged beyond rent and refundable security deposits, except for:
   (1) Utilities directly metered to the unit
   (2) Parking fees disclosed in the original lease
   (3) Pet deposits as permitted by law

(d) Landlords must include all required fees in advertised rent prices.

SECTION 3. Enforcement

Violations of this ordinance shall be subject to penalties of up to $1,000 per violation and tenant may recover actual damages plus attorney fees.

SECTION 4. Effective Date

This ordinance shall take effect 30 days after passage.
